p: Further, HLA-A03 has been described in one report in association with French LTNP [ 35]. This early observation of positive association of HLA-A03 with LTNP is now confirmed with our larger and stricter Spanish LTNP cohort. Otherwise, A03 has also occasionally been associated with populations of HIV-infected patients other than LTNP [ 37, 47]. As for HLA-A03, we also describe a significant association of the HLA-B52 allele with delayed disease progression in the Spanish cohort of LTNP patients, confirming an international HIV controllers study [ 22] and a single earlier report weakly associating HLA-B52 with non-progression in a small Brazilian cohort of HIV-1 infected individuals [ 48].
